title: Southern Horrors and Other Writings: The Anti-Lynching Campaign of Ida B. Wells, 1892-1900
description: Ida B. Wells was an African-American woman who achieved national and international fame as a journalist, public speaker, and community activist. This volume collects three pamphlets that constitute her major works during the anti-lynching Southern Lynch Law in All Its Phases , A Red Record , and Mob Rule in New Orleans .
author: Ida B. Wells-Barnett
